function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of population-scale epidemiological information for amr surveillance","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlations between antibiotic levels and abundance of args in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs like tamiflu and relenza are stockpiled globally and deployed during pandemics, leading to high proportions of communities taking the drugs in a short time window, resulting in the drugs and their metabolites being present in wastewater.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Antiviral drugs, if present in low levels in the environment, could cause irreversible effects to viral genomes, leading to resistance.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of antiviral drugs and their metabolized forms in wastewater streams contribute to environmental contamination and potential long-term impacts on microbial resistance.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited understanding of antibiotic consumption in the community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on antibiotic metabolites in wastewater analysis","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear impact of antibiotic usage on bacterial communities in wwtps","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited understanding of proteins in wastewater","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of investigation into stability of proteins in sewage systems","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unmonitored antimicrobial usage within a community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization in metagenomics protocols","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate utilization of urine proteomics for disease biomarkers","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited integration of urinary biomarkers in wastewater-based epidemiology wbe","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Challenges in assessing polio through sewage samples","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variability in efficiency of dna/rna extraction from pcr inhibitor rich samples","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the suitability of dpcr for certain sample types","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of wastewater to detect pathogenic organisms may lead to misinterpretation of disease prevalence in the community.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High mutation rates of rna viruses may lead to rapid adaptation and spread in new host populations.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical data from wastewater surveillance may not accurately predict future disease outbreaks.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Sewage system containing complex microbial communities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of water fingerprinting for community-wide infectious disease diagnostics","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wide array of endogenous chemical and biological urinary biomarkers linked with disease","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in population size making it challenging to monitor the emergence of infections within a community from
